description: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by form lines. LC Civil War maps (2nd ed.) 279 Maps of "Yazoo River defences at Walnut Hills" and "Haines Bluff" autogr. by Hausmann. Available also through the Library of Congress web site as raster image.

call_number: G3984.V8S5 1863 .U5 Copy 2 CW 279 Mounted on cloth, discoloration, holes along fold lines, two sheets pasted together, 4 maps on 1 sheet.
G3984.V8S5 1863 .U5 Copy 3 CW 279 Mounted on cloth, two sheets separated, 4 maps on 2 sheets (2 maps on each sheet).
contents: Yazoo River defences at Walnut Hills, near Vicksburg, Miss. : occupied by the U.S. Naval Forces, May 20, 1863 / surveyed for Rear Adminral D.D. Porter, commanding Mississippi flotilla, by sub. asst., C. Fendall -- Haines Bluff, Miss. : showing the positions of the attacking gunboats, April 30th, May 1st, 1863 / sketched by C. Fendall ... under direction of Rear Admiral D.D. Porter -- Vicksburg and vicinity / surveyed by C. Fendall & A. Strausz, under the direction of Real Admiral D.C. Porter -- Survey of a canal connecting Walnut Bayou with the Mississippi River : dug by the U.S. Forces under Genl. Grant in April 1863 / surveyed by C. Fendall & A. Strausz.
medium: 4 maps on 1 sheet ; 28 x 45 cm. or smaller, sheet 84 x 54 cm.
notes: Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by form lines.
Maps of "Yazoo River defences at Walnut Hills" and "Haines Bluff" autogr. by Hausmann.
Available also through the Library of Congress web site as raster image.
